parameters.name: PATCH
parameters.type: Used for updating resources with partial JSON data.  For instance, an Issue resource has title and body attributes.  A PATCH request may accept one or more of the attributes to update the resource.  PATCH is a relatively new and uncommon HTTP verb, so resource endpoints also accept POST requests.

parameters.name: PUT
parameters.type: Used for replacing resources or collections. For PUT requests with no body attribute, be sure to set the Content-Length header to zero.

parameters.name: X-RateLimit-Reset
parameters.type: The time at which the current rate limit window resets in UTC epoch seconds.

parameters.type: The value of this header is computed as the HMAC hex digest of the body, using the secret config option as the key.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Required. Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. These are defined below.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: Determines what events the hook is triggered for.  Default: ["push"].

parameters.name: insecure_ssl
parameters.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include "0" (verification is performed) and "1" (verification is not performed). The default is "0". We strongly recommend not setting this to "1" as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Required. Must be passed as "web".

parameters.name: secret
parameters.description: If provided, payloads will be delivered with an X-Hub-Signature header. The value of this header is computed as the HMAC hex digest of the body, using the secret as the key.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Required The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Can be the name of a user. Pass in none for issues with no assigned user, and * for issues assigned to any user.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The contents of the issue.

parameters.name: creator
parameters.description: The user that created the issue.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of the sort. Can be either asc or desc. Default: desc

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Indicates which sorts of issues to return. Can be one of:* assigned: Issues assigned to you* created: Issues created by you* mentioned: Issues mentioning you* subscribed: Issues you're subscribed to updates for* all: All issues the authenticated user can see, regardless of participation or creation Default: assigned

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: A list of comma separated label names.  Example: bug,ui,@high

parameters.name: mentioned
parameters.description: A user that's mentioned in the issue.

parameters.name: milestone
parameters.description: If an integer is passed, it should refer to a milestone by its number field. If the string * is passed, issues with any milestone are accepted. If the string none is passed, issues without milestones are returned.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Only issues updated at or after this time are returned. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: What to sort results by. Can be either created, updated, comments. Default: created

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Indicates the state of the issues to return. Can be either open, closed, or all. Default: open

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Required. The title of the issue.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Required. The role to give the user in the organization. Can be one of: * admin - The user will become an owner of the organization. * member - The user will become a non-owner member of the organization.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Indicates the state of the memberships to return. Can be either active or pending. If not specified, both active and pending memberships are returned.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter members returned in the list. Can be one of:* 2fa_disabled: Members without two-factor authentication enabled. Available for organization owners.* all: All organization members.Default: all

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Filter members returned by their role. Can be one of:* all: All members of the organization, regardless of role.* admin: Organization owners.* member: Non-owner organization members. This option requires a custom media type to be specified. Please see more in the alert below.Default: all

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Indicates the state of the memberships to return. Can be either active or pending. If not specified, both active and pending memberships are returned.

Avoid confusion by specifying a permission when using the Add team repository API instead.The permission to grant the team. Can be one of: * pull - team members can pull, but not push to or administer this repository. * push - team members can pull and push, but not administer this repository. * admin - team members can pull, push and administer this repository.If no permission is specified, the team's permission attribute will be used to determine what permission to grant the team on this repository.This parameter requires a custom media type to be specified. Please see more in the alert below.

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Can be the name of a user. Pass in none for issues with no assigned user, and * for issues assigned to any user.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The contents of the issue.

parameters.name: creator
parameters.description: The user that created the issue.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of the sort. Can be either asc or desc. Default: desc

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Indicates which sorts of issues to return. Can be one of:* assigned: Issues assigned to you* created: Issues created by you* mentioned: Issues mentioning you* subscribed: Issues you're subscribed to updates for* all: All issues the authenticated user can see, regardless of participation or creation Default: assigned

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: A list of comma separated label names.  Example: bug,ui,@high

parameters.name: mentioned
parameters.description: A user that's mentioned in the issue.

parameters.name: milestone
parameters.description: If an integer is passed, it should refer to a milestone by its number field. If the string * is passed, issues with any milestone are accepted. If the string none is passed, issues without milestones are returned.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Only issues updated at or after this time are returned. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: What to sort results by. Can be either created, updated, comments. Default: created

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Indicates the state of the issues to return. Can be either open, closed, or all. Default: open

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Required. The title of the issue.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Indicates the state of the memberships to return. Can be either active or pending. If not specified, both active and pending memberships are returned.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Indicates the state of the memberships to return. Can be either active or pending. If not specified, both active and pending memberships are returned.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Required. The state that the membership should be in. Only "active" will be accepted.

parameters.name: anon
parameters.description: Set to 1 or true to include anonymous contributors in results.

parameters.name: auto_init
parameters.description: Pass true to create an initial commit with empty README. Default: false

parameters.name: contexts
parameters.description: Required. The list of status checks to require in order to merge into this branch

parameters.description: Updates the default branch for this repository.

parameters.name: enforcement_level
parameters.description: Required. Who required status checks apply to. Options are off, non_admins or everyone.

parameters.name: everyone
parameters.type: Required status checks will be enforced for everyone (including admins).

parameters.name: gitignore_template
parameters.description: Desired language or platform .gitignore template to apply. Use the name of the template without the extension. For example, "Haskell".

parameters.name: has_downloads
parameters.description: Either true to enable downloads for this repository, false to disable them. Default: true

parameters.name: has_issues
parameters.description: Either true to enable issues for this repository, false to disable them. Default: true

parameters.name: has_wiki
parameters.description: Either true to enable the wiki for this repository, false to disable it. Default: true

parameters.name: homepage

parameters.name: license_template
parameters.description: Desired LICENSE template to apply. Use the name of the template without the extension. For example, "mit" or "mozilla".
